title: Add color property to voltage probes and simulation graphs
description: Adds an optional color property to simulation voltage probes, schematic voltage probes, and simulation transient voltage graphs, enabling custom color styling for voltage measurements in visualizations.
body:
Summary
- Add optional `color` property to simulation voltage probes, schematic voltage probes, and simulation transient voltage graphs
- Enables custom color styling for voltage measurements in visualizations

 Changes
- **SimulationVoltageProbe**: Added optional `color` field (src/simulation/simulation_voltage_probe.ts)
- **SimulationTransientVoltageGraph**: Added optional `color` field (src/simulation/simulation_transient_voltage_graph.ts)
- **SchematicVoltageProbe**: Added optional `color` field (src/schematic/schematic_voltage_probe.ts)
The color property accepts any CSS color string (e.g., "red", "#ff0000", "rgb(255, 0, 0)") and can be used to customize the appearance of voltage probes and graphs in circuit visualizations.

title: Add pcb_board_id and pcb_panel_id to pcb_cutout
description: Adds optional pcb_board_id and pcb_panel_id fields to the pcb_cutout interface for enhanced PCB cutout identification.

title: feat: Add a source component for voltage probes
description: Add new source_simple_voltage_probe component to represent voltage probes at the source level and add source_component_id field to simulation_voltage_probe and schematic_voltage_probe for linking.
body:
Summary
- Add new `source_simple_voltage_probe` component to represent voltage probes at the source level
- Add `source_component_id` field to `simulation_voltage_probe` and `schematic_voltage_probe` to enable proper linking between source, schematic, and simulation layers

 Changes
- Created `source_simple_voltage_probe` following the same pattern as other simple components (resistor, capacitor, etc.)
- Added exports to `src/source/index.ts` and `any_source_component.ts`
- Added optional `source_component_id` field to `simulation_voltage_probe` to link simulation probes back to their source component
- Added optional `source_component_id` field to `schematic_voltage_probe` to link schematic probes back to their source component

 Testing
- Added comprehensive tests demonstrating component creation and linking across all three layers
- All existing tests continue to pass

title: refactor: Consolidate voltage probe name to source component
description: Removes redundant name field from schematic_voltage_probe and simulation_voltage_probe since its inherited from the source component, updates simulation_transient_voltage_graph to reference source_component_id instead of schematic_voltage_probe_id and simulation_voltage_probe_id for cleaner data model, and updates tests to reflect the new structure.
body:
- Removes redundant `name` field from `schematic_voltage_probe` and `simulation_voltage_probe` since it's inherited from the source component
- Updates `simulation_transient_voltage_graph` to reference `source_component_id` instead of `schematic_voltage_probe_id` and `simulation_voltage_probe_id` for cleaner data model
- Update tests to reflect the new structure

This creates a clearer reference hierarchy where the name is defined once in the source component and referenced by derived components.

title: Add SOT-963 footprint definition and tests
description: Adds support for the SOT-963 package to the codebase, including implementation, export, and comprehensive tests to ensure parity with KiCad and correct SVG output.
body:
This pull request adds support for the SOT-963 package to the codebase, including implementation, export, and comprehensive tests to ensure parity with KiCad and correct SVG output.

Adds `stroke_width` support to the SOIC generator and uses the parameter for the silkscreen border.

### SOT-963 Package Support

* Added a new implementation for the `sot963` footprint in `src/fn/sot963.ts`, defining its parameters and generating its circuit JSON representation.
* Exported the new `sot963` footprint from `src/fn/index.ts` for use elsewhere in the project.

### Testing and Parity

* Added a parity test in `tests/kicad-parity/sot963_kicad_parity.test.ts` to compare the generated SOT-963 footprint against KiCad's version and verify SVG output matches expected snapshots.
* Added a unit test in `tests/sot963.test.ts` to verify the SVG output for the SOT-963 footprint matches the expected snapshot.

title: Fix SOT-363 parameters and add test snapshots for KiCad parity
description: Updates the SOT-363 footprint parameters and adds a test for visual parity with KiCads footprint using automated SVG comparisons.
body: This pull request updates the SOT-363 footprint parameters and adds a new test to check for parity with KiCad's footprint. The main focus is to improve the accuracy of the footprint and ensure visual consistency with KiCad using automated SVG comparisons. Footprint parameter updates: * Updated the `w` parameter from 1.94 to 2.56, `pw` from 0.3 to 0.4, and `pl` from 0.7 to 0.65 in the `sot363` footprint definition to better match the reference design. Testing and validation improvements: * Added a new test `sot363_kicad_parity.test.ts` that compares the generated SOT-363 footprint against KiCad's version using SVG snapshots and boolean difference analysis to ensure visual parity.

prop. This allows for defining pre-wired subcircuits and having those internal connections be respected upon      
instantiation.                                                                                                    

A new inflator, inflateSourceTrace, has been added to handle the creation of <Trace> components from source_trace 
definitions. The logic correctly traverses the group hierarchy within the subcircuit's JSON to construct valid    
hierarchical selectors for trace paths.                                                                           

A new test case has been added to verify that a trace connecting two resistors within a subcircuit's circuitJson  
is correctly inflated and rendered.

[[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R52) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R213-R214) * Exported `SOD323FL` from `lib/index.ts` for broader availability in the codebase. **Documentation and Testing:** * Added an example usage in `examples/SOD-323FL.example.tsx` to demonstrate rendering the new footprint. * Added a snapshot test in `tests/snapshots/sod323fl.test.ts` to verify correct rendering of the SOD-323FL footprint. ## 3D Render https://www.mouser.com/datasheet/2/258/BZT52C2V4LS_BZT52C39LS_SOD_323FL_-2511166.pdf

title: fix: adjust notch positions which use ChipBody
description: Adjusts the notch position calculation for several component footprint renderers to ensure the notch is placed on the correct side of the body by inverting the x coordinate for the notchPosition property.
body:
This pull request updates the notch position calculation for several component footprint renderers to ensure the notch is placed on the correct side of the body. The main change is inverting the `x` coordinate for the `notchPosition` property in all affected components.

**Standardization of notch position calculation:**

* In `lib/SOT-363.tsx`, `lib/SOT-457.tsx`, `lib/dfn.tsx`, `lib/lqfp.tsx`, `lib/ms012.tsx`, `lib/ms013.tsx`, `lib/qfp.tsx`, and `lib/tqfp.tsx`, the `x` value of `notchPosition` is now negated to consistently position the notch on the left side of the body, improving visual accuracy and consistency across all package types. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-d234e7d498134b288016f0b25f93f60c81b7136c13242f19f93f11a1fea07b81L112-R112) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-319375cc6369e8ee6e9d55d085b89cc7829cf9e4e552d22e35e6bffa26352df2L113-R113) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-31b9405cb4359515630bd37abd7d33fe20094ae4c4381a3957129db5f3606e89L75-R75) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-e2aaaf7029c344637e3889a16c67bd876f14a66fc3f231fb9e0d0f3bf92d9cceL118-R118) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-0a7b9c85f3b0c58dd4785e9e874b8ec83c9a834efcac7de29d60370f06d56b37L62-R62) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-bfd3b17cae0374f08f2da45d87fdcde679b84391f73dc2a415ccaddac1868f87L63-R63) [[7]](diffhunk://#diff-9011c2de31ee473491158b3220977f8995bcba14b539fb9a0d666861acb6116eL114-R114) [[8]](diffhunk://#diff-50195257c8f77d50ad818d4f7e49aeebb77bff5eec212f4a3d4466954717f9afL99-R99)

title: feat: show pin 1 in green color for ExtrudedPads (#220)
description: Implements pin 1 color differentiation in ExtrudedPads component to make it easier to visually verify correct component orientation.
body: ## Summary Implements pin 1 color differentiation in `ExtrudedPads` component to make it easier to visually verify correct component orientation. Fixes #220 ## Changes - Modified `ExtrudedPads.tsx` to detect pin 1 by checking `port_hints` array - Updated `FootprintPad.tsx` to accept `isPin1` prop and render pin 1 in green (`[0, 255, 0]`) instead of red - Updated `FootprintPlatedHole.tsx` to accept `isPin1` prop and render pin 1 in green (`#00ff00`) instead of copper color ## Pin Detection Logic The implementation uses `port_hints?.includes("1")` to identify pin 1. This correctly matches only pin 1 and does not incorrectly match pins 10, 11, 12, etc. **Verified behavior:** - Pin 1: `port_hints: ["1"]` `includes("1")` = `true` - Pin 10: `port_hints: ["10"]` `includes("1")` = `false` - Pin 11: `port_hints: ["11"]` `includes("1")` = `false` ## Known Issue - Incorrect Pin Positions in Footprinter During testing, I noticed that several components have incorrect notch/pin1 positions as generated by `@tscircuit/footprinter`. Examples include: - `ms102` - `ms103` - `qfp` variants - `lqfp` variants This means that while this PR correctly highlights pin 1 in green, the actual position of pin 1 may be wrong for these footprints or the notch position is wrong. This is a separate issue that should be addressed in a seperate pr for each component. please see the preview for more details

title: Implement SOD323F diode with example and snapshot tests
description: Adds support for the SOD323F diode package, including its 3D model implementation, integration into the renderer, and example and snapshot tests.
body: This pull request adds support for the SOD323F diode package to the codebase, enabling rendering and testing of its 3D model. The main changes include the implementation of the `SOD323F` model, integration into the 3D footprint renderer, and the addition of an example and a snapshot test. **SOD323F model implementation and integration:** * Added a new file `lib/sod-323F.tsx` defining the `SOD323F` component, which models the package's body and pads using `jscad-fiber` primitives. * Updated `lib/Footprinter3d.tsx` to import the new `SOD323F` component and render it when the footprint is `"sod323f"`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R51) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R210-R211) * Exported `SOD323F` from `lib/index.ts` for external use. **Examples and testing:** * Added an example file `examples/SOD-323F.example.tsx` to demonstrate rendering the SOD323F footprint. * Added a snapshot test `tests/snapshots/sod323f.test.ts` to verify correct rendering of the SOD323F package. ## 3D Render ## Ref https://assets.nexperia.com/documents/package-information/SOD323F.pdf

title: Implemented SOD323 diode with example and snapshot test
description: Adds support for the SOD323 diode package, enabling rendering and usage in 3D models and related tests.
body: This pull request adds support for the SOD323 diode package to the codebase, enabling rendering and usage in 3D models and related tests. The changes include implementing the new `SOD323` component, integrating it into the main rendering logic, and adding export and test coverage. **SOD323 Package Support** * Implemented the new `SOD323` component in `lib/sod-323.tsx`, defining its body, leads, and polarity strip for accurate 3D representation. * Integrated `SOD323` into the main rendering logic in `lib/Footprinter3d.tsx`, allowing it to be selected and rendered by footprint name. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R49) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R248-R249) * Added export for `SOD323` in `lib/index.ts` to make it available throughout the project. **Examples and Testing** * Added an example usage of `SOD323` in `examples/SOD-323.example.tsx` for demonstration and manual verification. * Created a snapshot test in `tests/snapshots/sod323.test.ts` to ensure the rendered output matches expectations. ## 3D Render ## Ref https://assets.nexperia.com/documents/package-information/SOD323.pdf

title: Add MS013 component and example, update Footprinter3d and index exports
description: Adds support for the MS-013 MSOP package to the 3D footprint rendering system by introducing a new component, integrating it into the renderer, and providing example usage and tests.
body: ## Add MS013 component and example, update Footprinter3d and index exports This PR adds support for the MS-013 MSOP package to the 3D footprint rendering system. ### Changes - Added new `MS013` component in `lib/ms013.tsx` for rendering the MS-013 MSOP package with configurable pin count, dimensions, and lead parameters - Integrated the `MS013` component into the `Footprinter3d` renderer, allowing footprints with the "ms013" identifier to be rendered as 3D models - Exported the `MS013` component from the main library index for external usage - Added example usage in `examples/ms-013.example.tsx` showing 16-pin configuration - Added snapshot test in `tests/snapshots/ms013.test.ts` to verify rendering ### Package Details - **Body dimensions**: 7.5mm 10.3mm (Y1 Y) - **Pitch**: 1.27mm (e) - **Lead width**: 0.41mm (b) - **Pin count**: Variable (8, 10, 14, 16, 20, 24, 28 pins typical) ### Reference Based on JEDEC MS-013 MSOP standard package specifications References: https://www.jedec.org/standards-documents/docs/ms-013f?destination=node/8517 https://github.com/tscircuit/footprinter/pull/19

[[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R31) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R242-R243) **Example and Test Coverage:** * Added an example usage in `examples/SOD-128.example.tsx` to demonstrate rendering the SOD-128 footprint. * Added a snapshot test in `tests/snapshots/sod128.test.ts` to verify correct rendering of the SOD-128 footprint. ## 3D Render ## Ref https://assets.nexperia.com/documents/package-information/SOD128.pdf

This change enhances the rendering of schematic_voltage_probe labels for better alignment and clarity.             

  Labels are now left-aligned for improved readability.                                                          
  When a probe has both a name and a voltage, the arrow now points to the name, with the voltage appearing on the
   line below it.

title: feat: Support name property on schematic voltage probes
description: Updates the schematic SVG rendering to support the name property on schematic voltage probes, displaying the name as the probes label and formatting it with voltage if present.
body:
This change updates the schematic SVG rendering to support the name property on schematic_voltage_probe.          

  If a name is present, it is displayed as the probe's label.                                                    
  If both name and voltage are present, the label is formatted as "name voltageV".                               
  Updated tests to include cases for probes with names, and names with voltages (including 0V).

title: Add support for PCB panels
description: Adds support for rendering PCB panels containing multiple boards.
body:
Adds support for rendering PCB panels containing multiple boards.
 

- Add `pcb_panel` element rendering on Edge_Cuts layer
- Skip edge cut rendering for boards with `pcb_panel_id` property
- Panel outline is drawn instead of individual board outlines
 

When a `pcb_panel` element is present:
- The panel's rectangular outline is rendered on the Edge_Cuts layer
- Boards inside the panel (identified by `pcb_panel_id`) skip their edge cut rendering
- Only the outer panel boundary is drawn

This allows proper manufacturing output for panelized PCB designs.

description: Fixes node name case in PRINT statements to match probe names exactly, ensuring consistency between node naming in the netlist and PRINT output.
body:
- Fix node name case in PRINT statements to match probe names exactly
- Update test expectations to verify uppercase node names in PRINT output

- Removed `.toLowerCase()` conversion in `circuitJsonToSpice.ts` so node names maintain their original case from probe definitions
- Updated all test assertions in `voltage-probe.test.ts` to expect uppercase node names (V(VOUT), V(N1), V(N2), V(N4)) instead of lowercase

SPICE PRINT statements now correctly preserve the case of node names as defined in voltage probes, ensuring consistency between node naming in the netlist and PRINT output.

title: feat: Use simulation voltage probe names for spice nodes
description: Modifies SPICE netlist generation to use names from simulation_voltage_probe elements for node naming, ensuring more readable and predictable netlists.
body:
This pull request modifies the SPICE netlist generation to use the names from   
simulation_voltage_probe elements for node naming.                              

This change ensures that if a voltage probe with a name like VOUT or N1 is      
present on a net, that name will be used for the corresponding node in the SPICE
file. This provides more readable and predictable netlists.                     

Key changes:                                                                    

  circuitJsonToSpice now prioritizes probe names for SPICE node names.         
  Added logic to prevent naming conflicts between probe-defined names (e.g.,   
   N1, N4) and auto-generated node names by adjusting the starting counter.     
  Updated unit tests to verify the new naming behavior and ensure determinism. 
  Fixed an issue where probes on floating ports were not assigned names        
   correctly.

title: Add automatic obstacle detection for elements outside packing tree & integrate getElementsOutsideTree
description: This PR improves the packing pipeline by automatically detecting board-level elements that are not part of the component tree and adding them as packing obstacles. Key Changes Introduced getElementsOutsideTree() to detect plated holes and other PCB elements not included in the circuit tree. Added these elements to packOutput.obstacles, ensuring pack solvers respect board-level geometry. Defaulted opts.obstacles to an empty array for safer merging. Updated repro pages and tests to demonstrate the new behavior. This ensures pack placement no longer overlaps with board-level plated holes or outline geometry, fixing incorrect placements and improving solver stability.
body:
This PR improves the packing pipeline by automatically detecting board-level elements that are not part of the component tree and adding them as packing obstacles.

Key Changes

Introduced getElementsOutsideTree() to detect plated holes and other PCB elements not included in the circuit tree.

Added these elements to packOutput.obstacles, ensuring pack solvers respect board-level geometry.

Defaulted opts.obstacles to an empty array for safer merging.

Updated repro pages and tests to demonstrate the new behavior.

This ensures pack placement no longer overlaps with board-level plated holes or outline geometry, fixing incorrect placements and improving solver stability.

title: Add Source Component Extraction, UUID Mapping & Port Linking in KiCad Footprint Processing
description: Adds a dedicated infer-component-type module for component-type detection and transistor polarity identification in KiCad footprint processing.
body:
This PR introduces a dedicated infer-component-type module and removes the inline inference logic from process-footprint.ts. It centralizes all component-type detection and adds proper support for determining transistor_type (npn | pnp) for simple_transistor components.

Key improvements:

Extracted all ftype inference into a standalone utility.

Added best-effort transistor polarity detection using value and library ID.

Updated processFootprint to assign transistor_type for all simple transistors.

Updated snapshots accordingly.

Improves maintainability and prepares the stage for more ftype rules later.

title: Add Source Component Extraction, UUID Mapping & Port Linking in KiCad Footprint Processing
description: This PR enhances the KiCad-to-CircuitJSON converter by introducing full source_component creation, automatic referencevalue extraction, component-type inference, and stable UUID-based mapping. It also fixes source-port assignment by correctly linking ports to their corresponding source_component_id. New helpers were added for reading footprint referencesvalues, inferring component types, and tracking footprint UUID  source component relationships.
body: This PR enhances the KiCad-to-CircuitJSON converter by introducing full source_component creation, automatic reference/value extraction, component-type inference, and stable UUID-based mapping. It also fixes source-port assignment by correctly linking ports to their corresponding source_component_id. New helpers were added for reading footprint references/values, inferring component types, and tracking footprint UUID  source component relationships.

title: Rect Expansion

Key changes include improvements to the rendering of 3D visualizations, adjustments to the handling of mesh nodes, and optimizations in the solvers logic for better performance and accuracy. The changes aim to enhance the user experience and improve the overall functionality of the rectdiff library.
